findings.title: Transaction ordering allows frontrunning of reward claim
findings.explanation: The contract separates reward updates (setReward) and reward claims (claimReward) under a shared `!claimed` condition. A miner or attacker can reorder a pending setReward and claimReward transaction pair so that claimReward executes first, allowing them to drain the existing reward before it is updated or refunded.
findings.fix_suggestion: Unify reward update and claim logic into a single atomic function or implement a commit–reveal or time-lock mechanism. Alternatively, track pending reward updates and enforce a waiting period before claims to prevent front-running.
